com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.iot

Class AWSIotMqttManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.iot.AWSIotMqttManager

  • public class AWSIotMqttManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The broker for applications allows receive and publish messages AWS IoT MqttClient Amazon Internet of Things AWSIotMqttManager implements a broker for applications and internet-connected things to publish and receive messages.

      • setReconnectRetryLimits

        public void setReconnectRetryLimits(int minTimeout,
                                    int maxTimeout)
        Sets the times to wait between autoreconnect attempts. The autoreconnect backoff algorithm starts at the minimum value. For each reconnect attempt that is unsuccessful the reconnect logic will increase the time it waits to attempt the next reconnect. The maximum value limits the largest retry time.
        Parameters:
        minTimeout - minimum timeout value in seconds.
        maxTimeout - maximum timeout value in seconds.

      • getMinReconnectRetryTime

        public int getMinReconnectRetryTime()
        Gets the current starting value for time to wait between autoreconnect attempts.
        Returns:
        the auto reconnect timeout value in seconds.

      • getMaxReconnectRetryTime

        public int getMaxReconnectRetryTime()
        Gets the current maximum value for time to wait between autoreconnect attempts.
        Returns:
        the auto reconnect wait time value in seconds.

      • getMaxAutoReconnectAttempts

        public int getMaxAutoReconnectAttempts()
        Get the current setting of maximum reconnects attempted automatically before quitting.
        Returns:
        number of reconnects to automatically attempt. Retry forever = -1.

      • setMaxAutoReconnectAttepts

        public void setMaxAutoReconnectAttepts(int attempts)
        Set the maxium reconnects attempted automatically before quitting.
        Parameters:
        attempts - number of reconnects attempted automatically. Retry forever = -1.

      • setConnectionStabilityTime

        public void setConnectionStabilityTime(int time)
        Sets the connection stability time. This is the time required to wait after receiving the CONNACK to declare the connection to be stable and established. When attempting to reconnect after a disconnect the client uses backoff logic to wait longer on each successive unsuccessful attempt. We reset this logic after a connection has been maintained for the length of connectionStabilityTime without disconnecting.
        Parameters:
        time - time to wait to declare a connection to be stable (in seconds).

      • getConnectionStabilityTime

        public int getConnectionStabilityTime()
        Gets the connection established time.
        Returns:
        time the client will wait to declare a connection to be stable (in seconds).

      • isOfflinePublishQueueEnabled

        public boolean isOfflinePublishQueueEnabled()
        Is the publish queue while offline feature enabled?
        Returns:
        boolean if offline queueing is enabled.

      • setOfflinePublishQueueEnabled

        public void setOfflinePublishQueueEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable offline publish queueing.
        Parameters:
        enabled - boolean queueing feature is enabled.

      • getOfflinePublishQueueBound

        public java.lang.Integer getOfflinePublishQueueBound()
        Get the current value of the offline message queue bound.
        Returns:
        max number of messages stored in the message queue.

      • setOfflinePublishQueueBound

        public void setOfflinePublishQueueBound(java.lang.Integer bound)
        Set the bound for the number of messages queued while offline. Note: When full queue will act as FIFO and shed oldest messages.
        Parameters:
        bound - max number of messages to queue while offline. Negative or 0 values ignored.

      • getDrainingInterval

        public java.lang.Long getDrainingInterval()
        Get the "draining interval" (the time between publish messages are sent from the offline queue when reconnected).
        Returns:
        long containing the number of milliseconds between publishes.

      • setDrainingInterval

        public void setDrainingInterval(java.lang.Long interval)
        Set the "draining interval" (the time between publish messages are sent from the offline queue when reconnected).
        Parameters:
        interval - milliseconds between offline queue publishes.

      • fullPublishQueueKeepsOldestMessages

        public boolean fullPublishQueueKeepsOldestMessages()
        Keep the oldest messages when publish queue is full?
        Returns:
        boolean true if set to keep oldest messages, false if set to keep newest.

      • setFullQueueToKeepOldestMessages

        public void setFullQueueToKeepOldestMessages()
        Set the queue behavior on a full queue to keep oldest messages. Default is keep newest.

      • setFullQueueToKeepNewestMessages

        public void setFullQueueToKeepNewestMessages()
        Set the queue behavior on a full queue to keep newest messages. Default is keep newest.

      • getKeepAlive

        public int getKeepAlive()
        Get the MQTT keep alive time.
        Returns:
        The MQTT keep alive time set by the user (in seconds).

      • setKeepAlive

        public void setKeepAlive(int keepAlive)
        Sets the MQTT keep alive time used by the underlying MQTT client to determine connection status.
        Parameters:
        keepAlive - the MQTT keep alive time set by the user (in seconds). A value of 0 disables keep alive.

      • setAutoResubscribe

        public void setAutoResubscribe(boolean enabled)
        Enable/Disable auto resubscribe feature. When enabled, it will automatically resubscribe to previous subscribed topics after abnormal disconnect. By default, this is set to true.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Indicate whether auto resubscribe feature is enabled.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.security.KeyStore keyStore,
                    AWSIotMqttClientStatusCallback statusCallback)
        Initializes the MQTT session and connects to the specified MQTT server using certificate and private key in keystore. Keystore should be created using IotKeystoreHelper to setup the certificate and key aliases as expected by the underlying socket helper library.
        Parameters:
        keyStore - A keystore containing an keystore with a certificate and private key. Use IotKeystoreHelper to get keystore.
        statusCallback - When new MQTT session status is received the function of callback will be called with new connection status.

      • connect

        public void connect(AWSCredentialsProvider credentialsProvider,
                    AWSIotMqttClientStatusCallback statusCallback)
        Initializes the MQTT session and connects to the specified MQTT server using AWS credentials.
        Parameters:
        credentialsProvider - AWS credentialsProvider used to create a WebSocket connection to AWS IoT.
        statusCallback - When new MQTT session status is received the function of callback will be called with new connection status.

      • disconnect

        public boolean disconnect()
        Disconnect from a mqtt client (close current MQTT session).
        Returns:
        true if disconnect finished with success.

      • resetReconnect

        public void resetReconnect()
        Reset the backoff logic to the initial values.

                             AWSIotMqttQos qos,
                             AWSIotMqttNewMessageCallback callback)
        Subscribes to an MQTT topic.
        Parameters:
        topic - The topic to which to subscribe.
        qos - Quality of Service Level of the subscription.
        callback - Callback to be called when new message is received on this topic for this subscription.

      • unsubscribeTopic

        public void unsubscribeTopic(java.lang.String topic)
        Unsubscribe from an MQTT topic.
        Parameters:

        Send a message to an MQTT topic.
        Parameters:
        str - The message payload to be sent (as a String).
        topic - The topic on which to publish.
        qos - The quality of service requested for this message.

      • publishString

        public void publishString(java.lang.String str,
                          java.lang.String topic,
                          AWSIotMqttQos qos,
                          AWSIotMqttMessageDeliveryCallback cb,
                          java.lang.Object userData)
        Send a message to an MQTT topic.
        Parameters:
        str - The message payload to be sent (as a String).
        topic - The topic on which to publish.
        qos - The quality of service requested for this message.
        cb - Callback for message status.
        userData - User defined data which will be passed back to the user when the callback is invoked.
